item.title: The bushes around the bus stop full of litter, 16th January
item.description:
The bus stop area is full of litter. Also the bushes behind, the area on the right of the bus stop in the bushes behind the litter boxes, a green plastic container has been left there, and litter is stuck inside the bushes all over this area. Please this area needs a proper clean up with bushes needing trimming yoo. Please do not respond that you have sorted if you haven't spend a least a couple of hours cleaning up the whole area properly. There is mice living there because litter has not been removed from bushes. Packets of crisps all over there

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All street lights don’t work, 16th January
item.description:
All street lights along Chalmers Walk, including the stairs, the ramp, and the entire landing, are not working. This has made the area extremely dark and unsafe to walk through, requiring the use of a torch for visibility.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road is falling apart with some really quite deep potholes, 16th January
item.description:
This road disintegrates after frost every year it has patches that don’t survive the next year. It’s a terrible waste of taxpayers money because you’ll just be back next year to do another round of patching up, it’s needed resurfacing for many years please get on it.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Plum Lane, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are lime bikes blocking the pavement and the pedestrian crossing at the junction of Baker Street & Dorset Street outside Tesco 55 Baker Street. There are lime bikes blocking the pavement and the pedestrian crossing at the junction of Baker Street & Dorset Street outside Tesco 55 Baker Street. We reported this yesterday morning and the bikes are still here causing obstruction to pedestrians and endangering them to cross safely

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dorset Street, Marylebone, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road Safety Risk – Persistent Flooding and Lack of Warning Signage, 16th January
item.description:
I am writing to formally report a recurring and hazardous flooding issue at the area geotagged within the attached map. The current state of the carriageway presents a significant risk to public safety and if left unaddressed, is highly likely to result in a multiple serious road traffic accident(s). The flooding at this site is not merely roadside pooling; it now extends across both lanes of the carriage way. This appears to be the result of two primary factors: Drainage Failure: Existing gullies appear blocked or insufficient to manage standard rainfall. Surface Irregularities: An uneven road surface allows water to collect deeply across the driving lane areas creating a high risk of aquaplaning. Over the past week alone, I have witnessed multiple "near-miss" incidents, including vehicles skidding, losing traction and performing emergency maneuvers to avoid the deepest sections of water. As the flooding now affects both lanes, drivers have no "safe" lane to transition into, further escalating the risk of a multi-vehicle collision. My car recently has been for an MOT and passed with no reccomendations however, when driving through this area myself, a warning light appeared on my dashboard which was the the stability control warning meaning the car is aware itself it has no control. The dual carriage way is 50mph which only contributes to the severity of an accident(s). Until a permanent engineering solution is implemented to fix the drainage and level the surface, I urge the Council to exercise its duty of care by: 1) Installing Warning Signage: Signage in the means of "road liable to flooding" or "reduce speed due to flooding" prior to this area in order to give road users advance warning in order to prepare. 2) Conducting a Site Inspection: Assessing the drainage system to clear any immediate blockages. 3) Level Road Surface Area The lack of any current warning signage is a significant oversight. This issue persists during every period of rainfall and requires immediate intervention before a fatality occurs. It is especially detormental at nightime as road users will not become area of the issue if not familiar with the road. I look forward to receiving a reference number for this report and a timeline for the proposed remedial works.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement always covered in bins - 139-149 Brayards road, 16th January
item.description:
Hi This stretch of houses always leaves their bins on the pavement 24/7. It has been like this for years. This causes major hazards for pedestrians and I also see people using them like litter bins which must mess up the recycling systems. Really grateful if you could try to do something about this. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 137, Brayards Road, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
